== Main Inclusion Report for digikam ==

=== Requirements ===

# ''Availability:'' http://archive.ubuntu.com/ubuntu/pool/universe/d/digikam, available for all supported architectures
# ''Rationale:''
** To be included in Kubuntu
 0. ''Security:''
** No <nowiki>[[http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvekey.cgi?keyword=digikam|CVE entries]]</nowiki>.
** No <nowiki>[[http://secunia.com/search/?search=digikamSecunia|history]]</nowiki>.
** No binaries running as root or suid/sgid.
** Does not open any port.
** Source code review:
 0. ''Quality assurance:''
** Package works out of the box without configuration.
** Package does not ask any debconf questions higher than priority 'normal'.
** No showstopper <nowiki>[[http://bugs.debian.org/src:digikam|Debian bugs]]</nowiki>.
** Good <nowiki>[[http://packages.qa.debian.org/d/digikam.html|maintenance in Debian]]</nowiki>.
** Active <nowiki>[[http://www.digikam.org|upstream]]</nowiki>.
** No critical bugs in <nowiki>[[http://bugs.kde.org|upstream bug tracker]]</nowiki>
** Does not deal with exotic hardware which we cannot support.
 0. ''Standards compliance:'' 
** Meets the <nowiki>[[http://www.pathname.com/fhs/|FHS]]</nowiki>, <nowiki>[[http://www.de.debian.org/doc/debian-policy/|Debian Policy]]</nowiki>
** Standard cdbs packaging, standard patch system.
 0. ''Dependencies:''
** <nowiki>[[https://wiki.ubuntu.com/MainInclusionReportDcraw|dcraw]]</nowiki> and <nowiki>[[https://wiki.ubuntu.com/MainInclusionReportLibkexif|libkexif]]</nowiki> are pending main inclusion.
